article.headline: BYU 68, Santa Clara 66
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. (AP) -- Mark Bigelow converted a three-point play with 15 seconds remaining to play as Brigham Young defeated Santa Clara 68-66 on Tuesday night in the championship game of the Cable Car Classic. Bigelow, who finished with 14 points, drove the lane 13 seconds after Kyle Bailey gave Santa Clara a 66-65 lead. He made a tough layup and the ensuing free throw to give the Cougars their third title in the event. Rafael Araujo had 18 points and 12 rebounds for BYU (9-2), and was named the Classic MVP. Mike Hall added 13 points. Bailey and Travis Niesen each scored 16 points to lead Santa Clara (8-6), which had won the previous two events. Brigham Young, making its fourth appearance at the event, won the Classic championship in its last two visits in 1994 and 1986, each time beating the Broncos in the final game. The Cougars came out firing in the second half, making five of their first six shots to spark a 15-3 run that erased a 10-point deficit and led to a 41-39 edge six minutes into the final period. The lead changed hands nine times and was tied on four other occasions over the final 14 minutes before the game was finally decided. Araujo, who recorded his eighth double-double of the season and the 26th of his two-year career, was effective inside and out, using his 6-foot-11, 280-pound body and soft shooting touch to help give BYU a 61-57 lead before fouling out with 4:22 remaining to play. Araujo was 6-of-10 from the field, and made both of his 3-point attempts. Jared Jensen's layup with 8:21 left in the first half gave Brigham Young a 22-15 lead, but the Cougars went cold over the next six minutes. Santa Clara went on a 15-0 run and grabbed a 30-22 lead on Brandon Rohe's short jumper. The Broncos outscored BYU 21-4 over the final 7:18 of the half to enter the locker room with a 36-26 advantage.
